results.title: Alan Marshall
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
A memorable discussion with an author of extraordinary spirit and charm, who is internationally known for his novel “I Can Jump Puddles”.

results.title: No more secrets
results.brief_description: Explores the issues of Child Abuse and provides strategies for both children and adults to enable them to deal with “secrets” which children often feel obliged to keep to themselves.

results.title: No myth
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions and Claire Jager
results.brief_description: This video exposes the entrenched attitudes and myths surrounding Australia’s most hidden crime: domestic violence. “No Myth” was produced to explain why secrecy, shame and misplaced guilt accompanies domestic violence, and why women who experience it are frequently too scared, ashamed and isolated to confide in anyone.
results.description: This video exposes the entrenched attitudes and myths surrounding Australia’s most hidden crime: domestic violence. “No Myth” was produced to explain why secrecy, shame and misplaced guilt accompanies domestic violence, and why women who experience it are frequently too scared, ashamed and isolated to confide in anyone.

results.title: Banjo's Australia
results.brief_description: This program explains A. B. Paterson’s contribution and significance to Australian literature from the 1890’s to the World War I. It traces Paterson’s personal history, his love of the bush, his admiration for camaraderie and spirit of the bush and the pathos and humour of bush life.

results.title: Beautiful lies: a film about Peter Carey
results.creator_credit: Australia Council, Australian Film Commission and Don Featherstone
results.brief_description: Peter Carey is one of Australia’s most talented writers. All four of his published works have won major literary awards. This film, takes a journey through his life and work and looks at the way he transforms his native country into a bizarre land of nightmares and surreal comedy. Throughout the film, an interview with Peter Carey is interwoven with lavish dramatisation. An intriguing and illuminating film about a remarkable writer.
results.title_for_label: Beautiful lies: a film about Peter Carey
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australia Council, Australian Film Commission and Don Featherstone

results.title: Les Murray
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
Filmed at his home, a poetry reading and on his family’s farm in Northern NSW, Les Murray shares his love for poetry in this colourful and engaging portrait.

results.title: Turning 18
results.creator_credit: Video Projects, Open Channel Productions, Penny Robins, Peter Kaufman and Tony Wright
results.brief_description: An amusing look at some serious issues that are related to turning eighteen - the age by which a person is legally recognised as an adult in this society. This program, subtitled, “Almost 20 Minutes” is a parody of the current affairs television program, “60 Minutes”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Video Projects, Open Channel Productions, Penny Robins, Peter Kaufman and Tony Wright

results.title: Fair go!
results.creator_credit: Victorian Trades Hall Council and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: Fair go! is a step towards meeting the needs of young people for information about their rights as workers. Using a fresh, entertaining presentation, the program follows the experiences of school-leavers Kelly and Sam, as they fall unawares into a series of near disasters in new jobs.

results.title: You'll Be Back
results.brief_description:
Looks at the problems of readjustment that prisoners face on their release from gaol. The dramatisation of particular situations illustrates the type of troubles that may occur and representatives from various organisations, such as Legal Aid, Odyssey House and Personal Emergency Services, advise on how to avoid trouble.

Featuring Gary Sweet as the protagonist, and music by Rose Tattoo.

results.title: Not just a number
results.creator_credit: Amalgamated Metal Workers and Shipwrights Union, Rob Richardson and Shalagh McCarthy
results.brief_description: A three part documentary examining industrial democracy in Australia: 1) Job redesign. Demonstrates how employees exercise decision-making, responsibility and initiative in their private lives and contracts with the usual workplace situation where most decisions are made by management. 2) Better managers. Shows a factory owned and operated by the workers providing a working example of successful worker participation and industrial democracy. 3) Is it a con? Examines unsuccessful industrial democracy initiatives where only the semblance of power has been transferred to the workers.
